title: JST, 1 Corinthians 7
content: I speak unto you who are called unto the ministry. For
this I say, brethren, the time
that ye shall be sent forth unto the ministry. Even
be as though they had none;
for ye are called and chosen to do the Lord’s work.
who weep, as though they wept not; and them who rejoice, as though they rejoiced not, and them who buy, as though they possessed not;
And them who use this world, as not
it; for the fashion of this world passeth away.
I would, brethren, that ye magnify your calling.
I would have you without carefulness. For he who is unmarried, careth for the things that belong to the Lord, how he may please the Lord;
But he who is married, careth for the things that are of the world, how he may please his wife;
therefore there is a difference, for he is hindered.
